userStories.title: Phase 2: Implement transplant calculator logic
userStories.description:
Build the transplant day calculation engine.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [x] Date calculation function works correctly
- [x] Handles edge cases (same day, past dates, future dates)
- [x] Returns correct day number (day 0 = transplant, day 1 = next day)
- [x] Unit tests pass for all scenarios

## Logic
Given:
- Transplant date: T
- Current/target date: C

Calculation:
- Days = C - T (using date-fns)
- Day number = Days + 1 (so transplant day = day 1, not day 0)

Wait, clarify: User said "transplant day is considered day 0" and "day after transplant day is day 1"
So: Days = C - T directly (no +1)

## Steps
1. Install date-fns: `npm install date-fns`
2. Create utils/dateCalculations.ts
3. Write transplantDaysSince() function
4. Test with various date combinations
5. Add validation for invalid dates
6. Write unit tests

userStories.title: Phase 2: Implement chemotherapy calculator logic
userStories.description:
Build the chemotherapy cycle day calculation engine.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [x] Date calculation function works correctly
- [x] Handles edge cases (same day, past dates, future dates)
- [x] Returns correct day number (day 1 = first chemo, day 2 = second, etc.)
- [x] Unit tests pass for all scenarios

## Logic
Given:
- First chemo date: C1
- Current/target date: C

Calculation:
- Days = C - C1 (using date-fns)
- Day number = Days + 1 (so first chemo = day 1)

## Steps
1. Create chemoDaysSince() function in utils/dateCalculations.ts
2. Test with various date combinations
3. Add validation for invalid dates
4. Write unit tests
5. Ensure consistency with transplant calculator pattern
